timeline.message:
Change finalization of elasticsearch distribution

- avoid to rely on afterEvaluate lifecycle hook
- allows us to define test cluster only in the task creation which can be later than afterevaluate

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't seem right. In both scenarios we return what is effectively an empty set of dependencies. If docker is available, or we don't consider this to be optional, we should return the configuration's build dependencies.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: I don't think either of these methods should be public. If I need to wire up dependencies I should depend on either the Distribution itself or getExtracted depending on what I'm using and then just rely on implicit dependencies.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: getBuildDependencies is required as ElasticsearchDistribution is implementing Buildable, so we cannot remove this without major rework. While working on this I noticed that ElasticsearchDistribution does a little bit too much at the moment and in one point we might want to split this up a bit one day
replies.author: breskeby

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't this just be Action<Distribution>? I don't see where we ever actually use the returned result of this function.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: Looking at this more, now that we make the default behavior to return the extracted archive, perhaps instead of exposing a getExtracted() method on ElasticsearchDistribution we should replace that with getArchive()?
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: having getArchive() sounds like a good idea. We still use getExtracted to have access to the files in ElasticsearchNode. We can probably rework that at one point, but I would not wanna do it as part of this PR and not broaden the focus of this PR
replies.author: breskeby
